citation: Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 52A of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 declare –

        (a) that part of the Bass Highway specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be a limited access road; and
        (b) the places of access for the purposes of section 52B of that Act to be those places set out in Schedule 2 to this proclamation; and
        (c) that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
29 July 1999

W. J. E. COX

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

P. A. LENNON

Minister for Infrastructure, Energy and Resources

SCHEDULE 1 - Bass Highway – Limited access road

Definition  Length in kilometres      That part of the Bass Highway from the western abutment of the Inglis River Bridge to the eastern junction of Montumana Road (East) as shown bounded by heavy black lines on Plans 4906, 4907, 4946, 4947, 4948 and 4949 in the Central Plan Register.  18.42
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   


SCHEDULE 2 - Places of access

Description  Location    Distance in km from centre of Inglis River Bridge  Pecks Road – north side  .330  Preolenna Road – south side  1.38  Ewingtons Road – north side  1.38  Baulds Road – north side  2.41  Tollymore Road – north side  3.87  Gates Road – south side  4.78  Sampsons Road – south side  5.88  Fists Lane – south side  6.82  Dobsons Lane – north side  6.82  Port Road – north side  8.12  Blackabys Road – south side  8.16  Boat Harbour Siding Road – south side  9.60  Morris Road – north side  9.95  Bramich Road – south side  11.59  Broomhalls Road – north side  11.76  Myalla Road – south side  12.82  Devils Elbow Road – north side  13.77  Rulla Road – north and south sides  14.55  Devils Elbow Road – north side  15.49  Whites Road – north side  16.31  Montumana Road (East) – south side  18.42
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 4 August 1999

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources.
